Name: Ancient Egyptians revered dogs—can this street dog return to that former glory?
Discription: With a population over 15 million, Baladi dogs are everywhere—and often mistreated or killed. But that’s starting to change.

Name: The last missing tomb from this wealthy Egyptian dynasty has been found
Discription: The tomb of Pharaoh Thutmose II is the first royal crypt discovered in recent years, and scientists have new powerful tools to analyze it.

Name: Do you have poor posture at work? So did the ancient Egyptians
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\Do you have poor posture at work.jpg
Discription: A new study suggests the ergonomics of an Egyptian scribe’s working life may be revealed in their bones.

Name: New scans reveal mummified crocodile's last meal
Discription: The adult reptile remained intact as scientists used X-ray technology to look deep inside the belly of the ancient beast.

Name: A practical guide to travel in Egypt, from tipping culture to independent touring
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\A practical guide to travel in Egypt.jpg
Discription: From packing tips to advice on haggling, here’s everything you need to know while planning your trip.

Name: How to plan the ultimate adventure in Egypt, from Cairo to the Red Sea
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\How to plan the ultimate adventure.jpg
Discription: Feluccas drifting down the River Nile, ancient wonders found in dusty temples, warm waters filled with tropical fish: Egypt remains one of the world’s most atmospheric destinations.

Name: Was this ancient Egypt's greatest military leader?
Discription: A pharaoh keen on conquest, Thutmose III transformed Egypt from an inward-looking kingdom into an expansionist empire.

Name: Ancient Egyptian 'funeral home' was one-stop shop for the afterlife
Discription: New evidence shows priest-embalmers were savvy entrepreneurs who offered burial packages for every budget.

Name: Ancient Egyptian 'head cone mystery' solved by archaeologists
Discription: Researchers have long speculated about the purpose and meaning of pointy “head cones” depicted in Egyptian art. Now they’ve actually found the real thing.

Name: Ancient Egyptians mummified millions of birds. Where did they get them?
Discription: Sacred ibises were sacrificed on an industrial scale—and new research may help us understand what led to the birds’ disappearance from the marshes of the Nile.

Name: Ancient Egyptian mummies discovered near much older pyramid
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\mummies discovered near much older pyramid.jpg
Discription: The roughly 2,500-year old mummies were buried near the White Pyramid at Dahshur, built by a pharaoh who reigned 3,800 years ago.

Name: See Inside This Newly Discovered Ancient Egyptian Cemetery
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\See Inside This Newly Discovered Ancient Egyptian Cemetery.jpg
Discription: Artifacts found inside the network of tombs suggest it contains a priest of the ancient Egyptian deity Thoth.

Name: Should women rule the world? The queens of ancient Egypt say yes.
ArticlesPicUrl: Images\ArticlesImage\The queens of ancient Egypt say yes..jpg
Discription: Egyptologist Kara Cooney has found that ancient Egypt turned to female leadership to rule and protect ancient Egypt in times of trouble. What lessons does the past hold for the women of today?

Name: These ancient artifacts honor Egypt's powerful queens
Discription: It wasn't uncommon for women to rule—to an extent—in this highly advanced civilization.

Name: Packing Food for the Hereafter in Ancient Egypt
Discription: When death came, as it inevitably did, the ancient Egyptian pharaohs and their relatives were ready for it. Each had spent years preparing a lavish tomb stocked with everything they might need or want in the afterlife, including food, preserved for eternity.

Name: Mummies, Thousand Statues Discovered in Ancient Egyptian Tomb
Discription: During excavations of a 3,500-year-old tomb near the city of Luxor, Egyptian archaeologists made what is being hailed as a major discovery.

Name: Egyptians used papyrus—and other ways of handling periods through the years
Discription: How we’ve dealt with our periods over millennia says a lot about our societies—and the persistent stigma surrounding menstruation.

Name: The Pyramids at Giza were built to endure an eternity—but how?
Discription: How the ancient wonder was built is one of Egypt's biggest mysteries. But archaeologists do have insight into who built them—and what they hold inside.

Name: She ruled Egypt and seduced the Romans. But who was Cleopatra?
Discription: The legendary pharaoh is known for using her political savvy and considerable charm to gain power. But, in truth, there’s little we know for sure about her life.

Name: Discovering King Tutankhamun's tomb: Harry Burton's photographs
Discription: It was one of the most remarkable archaeological discoveries of the 20th Century.But what was it like to first point a lens into the 3,000-year-old tomb of King Tutankhamun?
